name: Samir Gupta
title: Lead Data Scientist
research_interests: Machine Learning (ML) for Biomedical & Clinical domains

work_experience.org: Innovation Center for Biomedical Informatics & Dept. of Oncology, Georgetown University
Innovation Center for Biomedical Informatics, Georgetown University
Dept. of Computer and Information Sciences, University of Delaware

education.note: Dissertation: Extraction of knowledge for microRNAs and genes: Extracting connections through Association, Involvement, and Regulation

bullets: Built pipeline to identify immune-related adverse events from longitudinal clinical notes for cancer patients treated with ICIs (Georgetown–Lombardi Immuno‑Oncology Registry).
Developed extraction of NSAID usage attributes (drug, frequency, route, strength) from notes; used in an observational study of lung cancer survival (collaboration with Frederick National Lab).
MACE2k: text mining to extract variant–disease–drug response associations; investigates distant supervision & transfer learning.
eMIND: deep learning system (BioBERT, PubMedBERT) extracting variant impact evidence in AD/ADRD; curator‑vetted outputs included in UniProt additional bibliography.
Predicted immunotherapy response in NSCLC from demographics, labs, meds, and molecular tests.
Developed speech/acoustic + NLP pipeline to screen suicidality among US veterans (collab with VA & Psychiatry).
Detected post‑surgical opioid use disorder risk in upper extremity surgeries (Curtis National Hand Center; >2000 patients).
Curriculum design, instruction, and assessment for HIDS graduate program.
Instructor: HIDS 501 (Massive Health Data Fundamentals); HIDS 506 (AI/ML for Health Applications); Co‑mentor for Capstone.
TA for Data Structures, Intro to Algorithms, Intro to CS, Logic, and Machine Learning; grading & office hours.

awards: Professional Development Travel Awards: ICPC 2013, SMBM 2014, BioNLP 2015 & 2017
Program Committee: MASC-SLL 2018; AMIA Student Paper Competition 2021–2022
Journal Reviewer: PLOS One, Bioinformatics Advances, Journal of Biological Databases & Curation
Conference Reviewer: AMIA 2020 Annual Symposium; AMIA 2022 Informatics Summit
